name: JW Marriott Ihilani Resort and Spa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I just got back from a week long stay at the JW Marriott on Oahu. We were there celebrating our third wedding anniversary and our last big trip before we start a family. The trip was wonderful and the hotel was absolutely perfect.
reviews.title: Paradise on Oahu

likes.disliked: — Distance from Oahu attractions

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Prior to our arrival, we let management know that we were celebrating our anniversay. Upon arrival, our room was upgraded and a plate of fresh fruit was delivered to our room.
reviews.title: Outstanding

likes.liked: — Exceptional service and extremely comfortable ambiance
likes.disliked: — Having to request ice delivery

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms were very spacious and the bathrooms were even better. The hotel grounds were well kept and had every amenity. One of our favorite perks was the walking/ jogging trail that surrounded the 4 lagoons. Most mornings we woke up early and took a jog. It didn't even feel like we were exerting any energy because the views were so perfect. Another delicious perk was the complimentary coffee in the lobby each morning. I brought some Royal Kona home with me, but it just doesn't taste the same on the mainland.
reviews.title: hamburger service at filet prices

likes.disliked: — service and attitude

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2005, traveled with family
reviews.text: A grocery store and some casual dining restaraunts were only about 10 minutes away, so we frequented there to try and save some money on eating out. The food at the hotel was great, but very pricey.
reviews.title: A wonderful resort
Loved the beds, the people, the weather everything!
reviews.text: The valets were also great. Very friendly and efficient, but also always ready with directions or recommendations.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: We stayed here briefly following our long trip from the east coast. We were looking for something comfortable, away from the bustle of Honolulu, where we could adjust to the jet lag. Our ocean-view room was huge with two comfortable beds and a large living room area that faced the ocean. The staff were very helpful, and we had a nice light dinner in the bar, and outstanding breakfast.
reviews.title: Beautiful room, incredible ocean-view

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: My friend and I were staying in Waikiki for a week - prior to travel, we decided to add on a weekend stay at Ko-Olina, thinking we would have a spa weekend. We had extensively researched spas in Oahu and I had even visited the area last December - we were very excited about staying there and having a spa weekend at their beautiful facility. Unpleasant surprise upon checkin when the front desk advised that the spa was closed for renovations. There was a temporary setup in the Penthouse suite, but it was barely adequate for minimal services (massages) and there were no amenities. We had corresponded several times with the spa and no mention was ever made of the closure, nor was it disclosed on the hotel's website. I had used Marriott points plus $150/night to upgrade to a deluxe ocean front room (which was lovely by the way) - add to this the $36/night parking, $15/day internet and ridiculous prices at restaurants and pool bars - my lovely "just about free" spa weekend was almost completely ruined. I will say the room was beyond beautiful and it was so relaxing to sit on deck and watch the ocean - very private. The grounds and walks were beautiful too. But the food/drinks - blech, and too expensive. Pool also pretty small - multiple pools at the neighboring resorts (including Marriott's own beach club) looked much more inviting. Also you can tell that the lagoon area nearest this property will soon be a nightmare when the Disney resort opens fully - too many kids for my adult taste. Although the only hot tub had specific signage forbidding children under 10 to use it, the hottub was treated like a kiddie pool - MANY toddlers with floating toys in there every day. We finally had the pool attendant kick out the toddlers one afternoon and we suffered the wrath of parents' dirty looks the remainder of the day. (Why would parents even think it was safe to let a 18-month old use a hottub??) Italian restaurant on site had snooty wait staff, ridiculous prices and mediocre food. If I ever go back, I'll stay elsewhere but try to go to the spa after it's remodeled!
reviews.title: Spa weekend ruined by non-advertised Spa Closure

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: We found the ihilani very relaxing. We had a great view from the 16th floor of the beach. Disappointed because the spa was closed for remodeling. Food/drink expenses were what you'd expect from a resort, but plenty of places nearby that are cheaper. Did think that Marriott was cheap in the room coffee service-single servings and paper cups. Also the room fridge doesn't keep things cold constantly, so we couldn't safely leave food items in it.
reviews.title: nice place to stay
Awful - not worth the time, the money or disappointment From the JW brand
reviews.text: The brand is really compromised by the poor quality of this particular resort, the staff and the overall experience. It needs to be closed for a major six month overhaul. I guess I expect more from the JW brand - but this isn't it ... The dining facilities are run down, tired, dirty and just not well kept. The rooms are run down, old and frankly had quite a bit of mold in showers, and corners of rooms... The pool was silly, and again run down. The staff does not seem to be interested in the guest - really indifferent to my feedback... They are more intertested in their commute, and their personal schedules... Really hard to get attention. I was disappointed in the upkeep, the lack of investment and the silly prices for such a poor quality experience. The spa may have been nice 20 years ago, I felt bad for the people trying to clean the stained, decaying facilities I have been to many nicer supposed ."low end" suites and residences (by Marriott), they are much nicer! This doesn't deserve to be called a JW.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I can't say much more than many others have said about this resort. It's a beautiful resort in a quiet, out of the way location. The pool is very cold and too small, almost an afterthought. Beach activities are minimal and pricey as well.
reviews.title: Great resort, but...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A great spot to kick back and unwind.. the spa was wonderful. Out of the way but still close to almost everything. You will need a car but well worth the drive after spending the day downtown or on the North Shore.
reviews.title: Nice Place to unwind

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: This hotel is gorgeous and the surrounding property has so much to offer! We enjoyed the walking trail each morning because we just couldn't resist! The staff is so accomodating and welcoming! The pool is a bit smaller than I expected, but then again we spent most of time lounging on a beach chair in the sand!
reviews.title: Gorgeous Property, Fantastic Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was a bit disappointed to learn the spa was undergoing renovation due to an "emergency", but was very, very pleased with the massage I received in their temporary space!
reviews.title: Vacation of a life time

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: I am completely Marriott loyal and have stayed in many of their properties, but I can honestly say I will be headed back to Oahu just to stay at the Ihilani! Thank you everyone for making the trip so very special for us!
reviews.title: Very good, comfortable, great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: The JW Marriott is located 38 min from Waikiki the property a gated community. The pool is small in comparison to other hotels in Waikiki but a pleasure to swim in, the staff is extremely friendly within a day they greeted you by name. The room (600ft) and bathroom are very large . the balcony was so big that it contained a lounging couch, 2 wood Adirondack chairs and round table. The food was average except for Saturday night Seafood Dinner – The food was fabulous King Crab Legs, Oysters, Clams, Shrimp, and much more and a Chocolate Fondue with all kinds of fruit, cake etc – A GREAT BUFFET well worth the money.
reviews.title: 5 star Resort in Hawaii - Love the lagoons!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: We stayed three nights at this resort with our two college-age children after spending several nights in Waikiki. What a refreshing change and wonderful way to end our trip! This resort is far from the hustle and bustle of Waikiki - almost like going to another island. We had a corner room on the 14th floor with one lanai overlooking the pool and lagoon and another lanai overlooking the ocean! The service was awesome - from the valet parking attendants (well worth the extra few dollars) to the bell staff to the front desk to housekeeping to the pool/beach attendants. We couldn't have asked for more. Be prepared to spend a lot more than just your room charges, but this is a top tier resort in Hawaii, after all. Rent a cabana on the beach for half a day ($35) to really spoil yourself. Spend some time in one of the hammocks if you want to get a taste of heaven! And don't miss the sunset from the grassy area near the lagoon. The lagoon is great for small children (no waves) and also has pretty good snorkeling. There is free coffee and tea every morning in the lobby, and the coffee shop there has reasonably priced fresh fruit, bagels and pastry, if you don't want a full breakfast in the restaurant. If your stay includes a Saturday night, don't miss the seafood buffet. It's pricey, but well worth it! The concierge arranged a dolphin watching/snorkeling trip on the Ko Olina Cat - one of the highlights of our trip! We will definitely stay here again on our next trip to Oahu!
reviews.title: Awesome resort! Perfect Location!

likes.liked: — Great location with gorgious views of the lagoon and ocean!
likes.disliked: — Nothing - it's great!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I (both 30) stayed here for 6 nights in May. We originally had booked a mountain view room, but we did not like it so we upgraded to a suite. the suite was very nice, although nothing terribly impressive.
reviews.title: Depends on what you are looking for

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled solo
reviews.text: The grounds are gorgeous (see photos). While traveling, we checked out some hotels in Waikiki (way too crowded) and also Turtle Bay Resort. While it was nice, I think the Ihilani is the most beautiful place to stay on the island.
reviews.title: Loved it!

likes.disliked: — No Fridge To Use Without Charge

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As others have said, there is not alot to do in the evenings. You can go to dinner onsite, take the shuttle to Roy's nearby, or drive to Honolulu for the evening.
reviews.title: Nice place

likes.disliked: — Parking charges of $18 per day to self park

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: We were not terribly impressed with the food. Unlike others, we werent impressed with the breakfast buffett. The food was cold and there were birds all around. Room service breakfast was much better, although pricey. We werent impressed with the sushi place either, maybe b/c we are spoiled and have good sushi restaurants at home. The one restaurant we enjoyed immensely was Azul. It is expensive, but worth it, especially if you sit outside and take in the scenery. The service there is fantastic. We had two great servers there, Stuart and ?. I am a vegetarian and they made a special meal for me.
reviews.title: Doesn't live up to Marriott name...disappointing
Best swimming beach for children I have seen
reviews.text: My family and I recently stayed at the Ihilani resort for 7 nights. As a family of 6 we reserved two adjacent rooms which were very adequate. The resort itself was outstanding. The facilities and quality of the grounds was top notch as were the rooms. Given a choice, I would recommend ocean view rooms on the sunset side or upper level rooms on the pool side given the noise factor by the pool. My children really enjoyed the shark, ray and tropical fish pools and spent a good deal of time there. The beaches were the best I have ever seen for swimming. The lagoon at the Ihilani is the largest and nicest lagoon, however, be careful venturing out to the center point as there is an undertow.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2006, traveled with family
reviews.text: Overall, our experience was outstanding and I would return. I'm concerned about the long term future of this location because of all of the new construction of villas, timeshares and Ritz Carlton hotel. The lack of overcrowding is one of the most appealing features especially as the lagoons are like a gigantic swimming pool with lots of room to spread out. However, until the crowds become overwhelming, it's a great place to stay.
reviews.title: Near perfect for my family

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at the Ihilani for a week with our two sons (aged 4 and 8). The hotel bent over backwards to make each of us feel welcomed, safe, and happy. The supervised childrens activities were all excellent. The property (with private lagoons) itself was wonderful for just playing, and the ocean view room was was an excellent size for us.
reviews.title: Paradise under construction
Not 5 Star but very good...
reviews.text: Roys Hawaiian is practically across the street, and other superior restaurants are nearby if you tire of the good restaurants on the property.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On the whole, this hotel was everything we wanted. We will return soon!
reviews.title: A Hawaiian Paradise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: We just returned from a two week island hopping trip in Hawaii for our ten year anniversary. We also stayed at the Four Seasons on both Lanai and Maui and there are reviews on those locations posted as well. My impression of the JW Marriott at Ko Olina was that it was ok, but it was also marred by two incidents which I will detail below.
reviews.title: Not Impressed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As a Marriott Rewards Member we had a ton of points to use so we got 5 free nights at this hotel to start our Hawaiian adventure, paying only a small fee each night to upgrade to an ocean view. We arrived late (about 10pm) to a very basic check-in (no leis or anything). We were starving so I asked where we could get something to eat. I was told the only place was the lounge and it would be closing soon as well. By the time we unloaded our luggage in our room and got to the lounge we were told we had our choice of only three things on the menu - altogether not a good first impression.
reviews.title: Very enjoyable stay

likes.liked: — Our suite was amazing and had a fantastic view of the pool/lagoon/ocean.
likes.disliked: — Our suite was handicapped accessible, but the shower heads only came up to 5' high - not very accommodating for tall people.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: The resort is about 20 minutes from the airport and about 40 minutes from Waikiki. Although its nice to be away from crowds of Waikiki, just keep in mind that if you don't want to spend most of your time on the resort you will have to drive almost a half hour or more to go anywhere.
reviews.title: Spectacular !

likes.liked: — Size of the room and quality....marble and linens, etc.
likes.disliked: — Long drive with traffic to get to town

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: Our room was nice with a very large bathroom, making the size of the room a little on the small side. I had requested a refrigerator in the room since we were traveling with our kids and that had to be put in the bathroom, where the coffee maker was located as well. It was an odd arrangement - I know people love that wow factor of a huge bathroom, but at what cost? The ocean view was wonderful, though.
reviews.title: would not stay again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Since the hotel is on a man-made lagoon the water here is very calm, perfect for small kids or people who don't like waves. The sand is somewhat rocky with bits of coral in it, probably going back to the whole man-made process and not having hundreds of years to weather and soften. There are no services at the beach unless you rent a cabana, so you need to get your own towels from the pool area to bring to the beach, try to lay claim to one of the half dozen or so permanently afixed thatch umbrellas if you want shade and then walk back up again to the pool area if you want a ice water or something to eat. For something different, take a walk along the shore away from the lagoon (to the north), there is a rocky beach that has tons of little tidal pools where you can see fish, crabs and snails.
reviews.title: Great Hotel on the west side

likes.disliked: — Restaurant Service

reviews.title: Unbelieveable Ko Olina Resort
reviews.text: Absolutely fabulous!! Unbelieveable gounds, lagoon area, all you would expect away from the hustle and bustle of Honolulu.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms very very nice, comfortable, roomy, clean, guest staff very friendly, knowledgeable. Island paradise. Stayed on Kauia 1 week, wished I would have stayed both weeks at Ko Olina. Has to be one of Marriott's best.
reviews.title: very relaxing

likes.liked: — away from the crowds in the city
likes.disliked: — time to travel to the sights

reviews.title: Fantastic Experience; A bit far from Waikiki Action
reviews.text: Early mornings breathtaking from the lagoon area just feet from the ocean. Very relaxing, uncrowded lagoon beach front, able to relax and enjoy. Outdoor cafe, extremely large pool area, multiple hot tobs outdoor breakfasts beside the garden area adjacent to the pool area, or lagoon side cafe area facing the ocean. You won't believe it until you see it. Long walks from Ihilani to the Ko Olina area spectacular day and night. I would stay here again and plan to in the future. The sunsets are absolutely amazing from the room patios. Again, staff are above expecations, and very helpful and friendly. Wouldn't stay anywhere else. If your wanting paradise in Hawaii, this is it!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I wanted to go to Oahu and see the sights, but I didn't want the hustle and bustle of Waikiki. I'm there to relax - I don't want to be in the city. We booked our room at the Ihilani because it looked far enough away from the city, but close enough to drive in and see the sights during the day - we werent disappointed. The hotel itself is very nice, well appointed, and in an excellent location. The on-site lagoons are great for swimming or snorkling, and there is plenty of space and available lounges to lay out and relax. At some resorts, I've had to get up early to stake out a spot and a chair - not this one. The staff was very friendly and accommodating. Overall, I wouldn't hesitate to recommend it to someone that doesn't want to be surrounded by traffic, high-rises, and crowds.
reviews.title: wonderful place to relax and get away from hustle and bustle

likes.disliked: — A bit farther from other attractions

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Negatives:
reviews.title: Fabulous hotel

likes.liked: — spacious, homelike rooms, lanai with great lounge furniture
likes.disliked: — a bit distant from other parts of the island, not much at night

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled with family
reviews.text: First time visitor to Oahu, I had booked four nights at Moana Surfrider. Wife was apprehensive about staying in Waikiki, so I got a great deal on two nights here ($220 for both including breakfast each day and dinner one night!)...
reviews.title: Not again...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled with family
reviews.text: Plusses:
reviews.title: Loved this hotel

likes.disliked: — No ice on the floor

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 1. Rooms are huge, great bathrooms and lanais. Do not get an island view.
reviews.title: Excellent resort in Hawaii

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 2. Cool ponds stocked with sharks/tropical fish. Kids loved them.
reviews.title: Best Resort on Oahu!

likes.liked: — We paid for the least expensive room - garden/mountain view and got a fabulous ocean view because the garden/mountain just happens to be in front of the ocean! We watched the sun set into the ocean from our 6th floor lanai every day.
likes.disliked: — It was pricey, but we expected this. It's quite a drive to Waikiki Beach area and the traffic is bad during rush hours.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 3. Lagoons, artificial, were good for little kids.
reviews.title: Not too excited about this one!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was a fabulous hotel, off the beaten path. It was secluded, but with everything one might need. The lagoons (beaches) were nice and quiet and not crowded. The hotel offered amenities, like snorkeling, canoeing, kayaking, etc. The whole ambaience of the hotel was amazing. From the shark pond, the pond filled with ocean creatures, the private lagoons, the poolside and pondside restaurants to the fabulous rooms, the hotel, overall is a wonderful place to stay. We plan to take our kids back soon. The rooms are wonderfully romantic, with large bathrooms (seperate tub/shower, marble thru-out) and large balconies that overlook the ocean (you hear the waves crashing 24/7). But the resort is great for families with children also. The lagoon beaches make it a safe place for kids to play and swim - no waves, etc. The food is good, not overpriced. The room service is prompt and efficient. The lobby is beautiful and the gift shops have plenty to offer. If you want nightlife, tons of restaurants to choose from and a hoppin' beach scene, this is not the resort for you, but if you want a laid back, quiet, elegant, relaxing resort, then you've found the right hotel.
reviews.title: Fabulous hotel.....

likes.liked: — The seclusion of the resort - there were times I felt like we were one of only a handful of people
likes.disliked: — There weren't many restaurants to choose from - but it was worth it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the JW Marriott in July and loved it! The hotel was very nice and away from the traffic of Waikiki. The grounds are beautiful and the beach was excellent for small kids (no waves or undertow). The pool was not as big as I would have liked but we never had a problem getting chairs. The restaurants on-site were very good. Be sure to rent a refrigerator for drinks/snacks.
reviews.title: Great Choice!!

likes.disliked: — Pool was small

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would recommend this hotel to anyone!
reviews.title: A fine, remote, hotel

likes.disliked: — Not a great pool

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at the JW Marriott Ihilani Resort & Spa twice, for a total of four days, during a two week trip to Hawaii in October ‘07. Both accommodations were upgraded ocean view or ocean front rooms, but not suites. Perhaps because I anticipated a generic Marriott experience, the Ihilani exceeded my expectations for these stays because of the rooms, service and setting. The biggest weak points I noticed were the somewhat sterile and dated lobby/atrium and the ho-hum pool, which can’t compete at all with the surrounding gardens, beach and fish ponds. Also, the hotel charges for their Internet connection and don’t think of staying here long without a car. The rooms were large, spotless and fresh looking, with bathrooms with separate showers and Jacuzzi tubs and beds that were very comfortable.
reviews.title: A wonderful honeymoon destination

likes.liked: — The room and the amazing view from our balcony
likes.disliked: — Nothing!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The manufactured bay makes easy swimming, even when the ocean is rough or you are with children. The three restaurants plus pool bar offer a nice range of eating choices, although nothing is cheap. There were many young and large families there when we were who must have had budgets we never did at that age. The hotel’s breakfast buffet was one of the best we have found anywhere and is a special treat if you are on a package that includes it (otherwise $27 each) in your room price. The hotel’s upscale dining room also served us the best dinner we had in our two weeks in Hawaii (including the Four Seasons Resort Lanai at Manele Bay).
reviews.title: Rush hour traffic on vacation, Yeeeech!

likes.disliked: — Location far from the action. Really dead after dinner time.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: The JW Marriott is designed to separate you from the average traveler, for it is an upper class hotel. As a Marriott is still feels like a business hotel, but it has many resort features to the liking. For example, it has a semi-private beach versus Waikiki Beach and a resort style pool. The pool service kept bringing us items throughout the day like ice water, juice, and iced cold towels. The food there was above average. What we liked best about this hotel was that is was not crowded and not too many kids. There is a Marriott nearby and on the same property, which is very kid friendly.
reviews.title: Great Hawaiian Experience

likes.disliked: — Handed us leis instead of placing them on us

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: Our room was designed as tropical, but the furniture was cheap looking. The room décor needs to be updated. We had a great view of the pool and ocean, and the bathroom was up to luxury standards. The cleaning service was excellent including the daily and turndown. We had an excellent stay with no problems. This is a great place to stay if you do not want to stay in Waikiki with all the tacky tourist stuff around you.
reviews.title: Disappointing Return Stay - Management Indifferent- No Aloha Here

likes.disliked: — cold pool, unfriendly workers

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: Last year we stayed here a week and fell in love. This year we broke up and it was sad- because the Ihilani just didn't care.
reviews.title: Truly a great hotel (yeah, it's pricey, but still great)

likes.liked: — The upscale nature, and luxury, as well as the locale.
likes.disliked: — Nothing.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We will never return. The pool was freezing and empty (not heated- even the kids stayed out, now THAT is a cold pool to keep kids out). Little elegant touches are no more. Turndown service is no longer automatic-- imagine paying $500 a night and coming back to your dirty towels and unmade bed after an elegant evening out. What is management's response? One hint: we woke to the same mess. No offer to send someone up.
reviews.title: Fantastic Rooms - common areas mediocre

likes.disliked: — Common Areas

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This indifference trickles right down to the car parkers who were actually unfriendly (yes we tipped). Surly would be a better word.
reviews.title: Lovely Ko Olina!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: After spending a week with our children and grandchildren at The Disney Resort "Aulani" next door, my husband and I had a few "adult" days at this hotel before traveling to a condo on Kauai.
reviews.title: Elegant resort and Spa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: We had a corner suite on an upper floor that looked out over the water, pools and gave us a great overview of the Disney Resort next door. All of the hotel amenities were five star. The large balcony had full sliding glass doors and it was great to listen to the ocean at night. We had a romantic dinner in their Italian Restaurant. The chef joined us at our table and gave me his secret for the wild mushroom risotto we had enjoyed at dinner. Beautiful garden setting. The breakfast buffet was lovely and did not include the "flying insects" that hovered over the buffet selections in the Disney buffet restaurant. All the pool amenities were lovely and we enjoyed a drink at the bar at sunset. It was a nice quiet interlude after a great, busy week with family next door at Aulani.
reviews.title: Luxurious guest rooms but we missed having a natural beach with waves!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012
reviews.text: This is a lovely resort and I was impressed by the luxurious and spacious guest room and bathroom! We had booked an ocean view room but only had partial viewed of the ocean and mountains on the other side. We asked for an upgrade when we checked in but were told that none was available for our specific room type, 2 double beds and not facing Disney property. Overall the resort is beautiful with the saltwater lagoons adding a nice touch and the restaurant staff and bellman was very helpful with directions and restaurant suggestions. Restaurants in the hotel were expensive but we expected that so we decided to just do breakfast and lunch in the resort and visited nice restaurants outside the resort for dinner. 2 places I will recommend( and I will write reviews later) is Roy's Ko Olina which is at the Ko Olina beach club and there is a hotel shuttle that wil take you there. Also visit the Hula Grill at the Outrigger at the beach in Waikiki for dinner. Back to this resort review, the only negative is that there is no natural beach with waves that you can access. My son loves the ocean and it's waves and even though the lagoon was right outside the resort and great for kids, there are no waves like a real ocean and we missed that. The pool was good not great, we have been to other Marriott sorts which have bigger pools with waterfalls and slides but this one was just a basic round pool so I was disappointed with the pool area. The Ko Olina area is definitely more private than the crowded Waikiki area so if you are looking for a peaceful,relaxing vacation in Oahu then Ko Olina is a great choice. we did drive to the North Shore and that felt like the real Hawaii with the natural beaches and big waves and we stopped ate some local fruit stands and bough fresh cut up fruit and had fresh cooked shrimp from Fumi's shrimp truck which was awesome. Thanks to Sean from Marriott Vacation Club for telling us to do the North Shore drive and he was kind enough to tell us which beaches to stop at, which shrimp truck to eat from and the local fruit stands etc. Overall our trip to Jw Marriott Ko Olina was wonderful but please consider the lack of a natural beach if that is your priority.
reviews.title: Lovely resort but needs some TLC

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012
reviews.text: Went here last week to surprise our friend who was celebrating his 50th birthday- that said, we would have been happy anywhere, so that rather colors my review.
reviews.title: Beautiful Location on Oahu

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: Nice location away from Waikiki, but now rather crowded into a lagoon with a massive Disney complex. I'm not complaining but I'm sure it was much nicer B.D. (Before Disney)
reviews.title: Quiet,comfortable, clean and private beach: wish I was still there

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just got back from a 4 day stay at JWM, and we can't wait to go back!! We got there a couple hours early, but we were able to be upgraded to an ocean view room on the 8th floor! Wow, The room was huge, the bathroom was huge, and the sunsets were so perfect. From the view from the lanai, we could see up and down the beach. There was construction the next lagoon over, but it didn't bother us at all. They gave us a complimentary bottle of champagne (for our anniversary). We got the package deal, so it came with the rental car and breakfast for 2 for $28.00. It was the best buffet we've ever been to. The pool was really crowded with kids, but we also came during Spring Break - it would be crowded anywhere! We enjoyed the lagoon, the hamocks, the long walks, ate dinner at the terrace. We loved the location - away from Waikiki and the crowds and traffic. We went into Kapolei to Chili's one night for dinner, only about a 10 minute drive.
reviews.title: Awesome - can't wait to go back!!!

likes.disliked: — The shower - I dreaded getting in

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007
reviews.text: If you want paradise and gorgeous sunsets, and no crowds, this is it! We''ve been married 30 years, and celebrating in our room was wonderful, so the fact that it was "away from everything" didn't matter to us. We drove one day up to Turtle Bay Resort - too far - JWM was only about 25 minutes from the airport.
reviews.title: Wonderful family getaway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Only negative is that the bathroom shower was gross! Needs new grout, and good scrubbing. For such a huge bathroom, you'd think the shower would be bigger too. We were in the wheelchair capable room, so the shower did have the seat in the shower, but still, it was small and dirty looking.
reviews.title: So relaxing and soothing - beautiful resort

likes.disliked: — cost for us was pretty high - we spent about $450 for one night.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: All in all, we're planning to go back next year, if not sooner! The staff, the restaurants, the pool attendants, the valet - everybody was so helpful, and courteous. We'll definitely be back!!
reviews.title: Good Hotel - Highly Recommend, with caveats

likes.disliked: — Spa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: We just returned from 4 days/4 nights at the Ko Olina. It was a wonderful getaway. I totally agree with Profguy's review, posted 3/31, so instead of repeating what he said, I'm going to mention a few other details.
reviews.title: Great Stay

likes.disliked: — Rest in area are lacking

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: I just returned from a 5-night stay at the Ihilani. I was bringing my parents to Hawaii for their first-ever visit, so I chose Oahu for the tourist sites and the Ihilani to get away from the crowds of Waikiki. Oahu is not my favorite island; the glitz and congestion seems so anti-Hawaii, but we managed to have a fine time anyway.
reviews.title: Mixed Bag at the Ihilani

likes.disliked: — Overpriced, generic, not very interesting location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: Things got off to a rocky start at the hotel. We arrived a check-in time to find one room ready and the other not...not terrible, but frustrating after a 6-hour flight. It seemed to take forever for housekeeping to finish up, and we didn't get into the second room for about 2 hours. The hotel did make up for it by giving us 2 days' worth of comp breakfast buffets, which was actually quite a bit (more on food and pricing later).
reviews.title: Nice Stay

likes.liked: — The suite was large and roomy and the two bathrooms were great, especially travelling with two girls.
likes.disliked: — The suite that we were in had a outside entrance, which made it a little noisy in the mornings.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: The rooms were large, bright and had wonderful balconies. We had corner rooms on the 10th floor with 2 balconies each, and the lanais were good for viewing whales and the nightly hula show. Considering prices for rooms in other places, it seemed fairly reasonable.
reviews.title: Mixed feelings about the service, but great rooms

likes.disliked: — Staff spirit

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What was NOT reasonable was the way the hotel socks it to you at every possible opportunity. Fees upon taxes upon surcharges...$18 per night for parking, and then a tax on top of that! They tried to charge both rooms for parking even though we only had one car! The mini bar, room service and restaurant prices were much higher than usual...$28 per person for a mediocre breakfast buffet, with no other cheaper options nearby. We ate in all 3 of the hotel's restaurants and found them to be good but not great and too expensive. Service was usually pleasant and at least competent.
reviews.title: Resort Good, Guests Bad!!!!

likes.liked: — Very friendly staff fixed problems quickly
likes.disliked: — the other guests

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2005, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One rather nasty feature is the business center which charged the highest per-MINUTE rate I have ever seen to go online. 5 minutes' worth to check E-mail cost me nearly $7!
reviews.title: Hawaiian paradise

likes.liked: — Variety of activities for all ages, breakfast buffet
likes.disliked: — The on-site restaurants were a bit pricey

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had the privilege of staying at the Ihilani from August 28 to 31, 2006 on the first leg of a two island trip. This is a spectacular property with wonderful service. I specifically booked this property to avoid the congestion of the Waikiki area, and anyone who relishes the feeling of seclusion will appreciate it.
reviews.title: Oahu Oasis...Ihilani is Paradise Found

likes.disliked: — Nothing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This resort is a twenty minute drive west from the Honolulu airport, which is approximately forty-five minutes from Waikiki. The resort is nestled within the gated Ko'Olina resort community. When we pulled up to the resort, we were greated by the valet who said "we'll take care of everything." After an effortless check-in, we received a call from the bell desk asking if we were ready for our luggage. This was an excellent start to a great stay at the Ihilani.
reviews.title: A treasure in Oahu

likes.disliked: — Not a lot to do outside the Ko Olina area

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled with family
reviews.text: We booked an ocean-view room with the breakfast package. (More on the breakfast later). Our immaculate and spacious room (4th floor) overlooked the pool and one of the Ko'Olina lagoons. It was magical. I travel a lot for business, but this trip was our anniversiary and the Ihilani did not dissapoint.
reviews.title: No Waikiki Here, Just Hawaii As It Should Be

likes.liked: — The exceptional quality of the property
likes.disliked: — Hotel food prices and poor quality

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room...is very nice with a separate seating area, a large balcony, and a huge bathroom with his/hers sinks and tub and a separate shower. There is a fully-stocked mini-bar, but beware as there are many goodies which carry a hefty fee. You will have to figure out all the other great features of the rooms when you get there!
reviews.title: Heaven

likes.disliked: — Paying for Valet Service - bit retarded.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled with family
reviews.text: Dining - The Ihilani has a magnificient Japanese restaurant called "Ushio Tei," which served a fabulous buffet on our first night. The selections were numerous and fresh, including out-of-this-world creme brule. Again, for more detail...go there!!! We wish we could again, and again. They also have the absolute, without a doubt, best breakfast buffet...ever. (There is a scale in your room, which I recommend that you don't pay any attention to while you are there). They have smoked salmon, eggs, fresh fruit, omlettes, etc. (I promise...I don't work for the Ihilani!).
reviews.title: Amazing Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I started my holiday by staying in the Waikiki area. I have been to both the reasonably priced Marriott Courtyard and the Hilton Hawaiian Village. Both are close to the main attractions and the busy tourist spot of Oahu. After several days, my final stay in Oahu was located 30 minutes away from Waikiki. It's approximately a $90 taxi ride to Ko'Olina where JW Marriott IHILANI is located. I've been excited in staying at this resort as I've seen great photos from the web. After the tiresome Friday night at the Hilton Hawaiian Village, we moved to the Ihilani after the rush hour traffic cleared on H1. As soon as we took the exit off the freeway, I noticed a big difference in the area. Definately a nice location with great new homes and resorts around the area. Near by is the Luau called "Paradise Cove" within walking distance from the Ihilani and the Disney Resort. As I drove up the driveway at night, the biggest difference is that this is definately more secluded, most peaceful, and less crowded compared to all the hotels in Waikiki. Along the driveway you will see the lit torches lined up to welcome you upon arrival. The vallet staff immediately helped out with the luggage. The ambiance is peace and quiet and very romantic. If I get married, I would definately consider returning to this place. As soon as I opened the door, the nice room with white shutters and elegant fan rotating above is a feeling of luxury and paradise. As I walked one of the two balconies I hear the waves crashing to the rocks. I hear birds singing. I left the double doors open with only the screen door closed. The shutters slides to the side and slept so peacefully with the sound of the birds and the waves. The following day was filled with lots of walking around the beach and taking a dip in the lagoon. The restaurant is great. But keep in mind, this is not a cheap or bargain hotel. The food is not cheap as well. This is probably the main reason why only a handful of people are seen around the hotel and as compared to the Waikiki chain of hotels, this is like night and day. Total complete opposite. Worth the money? I believe so. You pay for the quiet romantic moments and location of this wonderful taste of paradise.
reviews.title: The Taste of Paradise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is our fave hotel in Oahu whenever we visit Hawaii, as it has amazing views and great rooms. Our stay over the Christmas was mostly ok, but a lot worse than any other time of the year, for the following reasons:
reviews.title: Xmas stay at the Ihilani

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: 1. Our booked room was not ready when we walked up to it, it had no power supplied to it and was under construction (last thing you want after checking in quite late at night). 2.The staff are so busy with the guests (it gets crowded over xmas) you get sub-standard service - house keeping missed cleaning our room and wouldn't make it up despite numerous times of us calling front desk and house keeping , finally after getting fed up we walked down to the front desk personally and asked that our room is made up at 11.30PM!! And the house keeping manager looked less than delighted to oblige like she was doing us a favour. 2(b)While out trying to hire out snorkel gear to go snorkeling in the lagoon we waited about 15 minutes by the cabana where there are usually staff who can serve you there and there was absolutely no one in attendance. The young men who were on duty were too busy trying to hook up with girls at the lagoon , and there was about 5 of us waiting patiently until we got annoyed and went to ask the pool attendant to get someone to the snorkel gear cabana. And finally that happened.
reviews.title: Great resort away from the hustle and bustle

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 3.The showers in the rooms we stayed (stayed in two diff rooms as we visited twice in Dec) in were absolutely filthy with black mould. So sad for deluxe ocean view rooms that have been recently renovated and made beautiful. The fridge in our room was dirty as well from previous guests spilling something inside of it.
reviews.title: Great Change of Pace

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012
reviews.text: 4.We could not use the Jacuzzi by the pool as kids kept on diving into it and throwing their swimming gear in. There was no one in attendance not even their parents to tell them to go play in the pool as this is an adult area really. Made is incredibly unpleasant to be in the Jacuzzi and have a peaceful pinacolada , so we up and went.
reviews.title: Stay somewhere else!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Let me start out by saying my husband and I are around 30, with no kids. I basically plan my travel around the reviews on tripadvisor- so I am going to be as detailed as possible, but try to not repeat things I agree with on previous posts! Sorry for the length- but hope it helps!
reviews.title: First Anniversary with an Earthquake!

likes.liked: — Nice comfortable rooms, awesome view of sunset, beautiful walk by lagoons
likes.disliked: — Got bored easily as a young couple, no drinks in pool or lagoons

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was very easy to find from the Airport and after we rented a convertable at the airport (I would not do it any other way!) and it took us about 35 minutes to get to the hotel. We checked in and were given fresh towels to cool our hands (no leis to our dismay!).
reviews.title: Our favorite hotel in Hawaii to date

likes.disliked: — Dinner Selections, Pay to park

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled with family
reviews.text: Our room was unbelievable! It is very large, with a couch, chair, coffee table and desk across from the bed. The decor is minimal which is great b/c of the view. There are large window/sliding glass door. Balcony is very roomy. You can either have shutters, screen, or shut the glass doors. Note the nitelite under the nightstands! A nice glow for late at night- the switches are next to you in bed on stand. The bed linens and comforter were AWESOME, but I think Marriott usually has softer beds, so I was surprised it was not as soft. Six pillows on the bed- so have your pick of hard, soft, or med! Plenty of places to unpack your clothes- and around 10 hangers. You also have robes and shoes.
reviews.title: Beautiful, relaxing resort!

likes.disliked: — The bed sheets

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We paid for garden view upgrade and they "upgraded" us again for ocean view- which put us over the stingray pool with a partial view of ocean. But we could see the sunset easily which was great.
reviews.title: Better then a Ritz Carlton experience!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Pool was okay- and unfortunately, it was 8-10 days after a full moon which is when jelly fish come, so lagoons were out for a few days (however people were in them and I did not see anyone get stung). If I could recommend going to the back of the pool area- by the lagoon, the chairs are turned to the lagoons so you get the breeze from the lagoons- but you can have your drinks! No drinking IN pool or down by lagoons. So this spot worked out well for us and no one else seemed to notice how perfect the seats were! They are VERY generous with their towels by the pool and we never had a problem getting any.
reviews.title: Wonderful Experience

likes.disliked: — N/A

description: The JW Marriott Ihilani Resort and Spa is an oceanfront hotel that overlooks one of four beach coves. AAA Four Diamond rating with spacious guest rooms and lanais located on the western shore of Oahu. Guests enjoy on the on-site spa, sumptuous dining options and the championship Ko Olina Golf Club.
